concerts.description: Went with Victor and we were wowed by their insane energy. It was jam-packed and the crowd went wild for them. They played the Sims music as they came on stage!
Second time seeing them, again with Sam. Some great moments. They played a deep cut from 'Ugly Season' that I love.
Awesome lesbian punk band from a friend of Tobias. Beaten only by the warm-up band 'PMS Hit Fabrik'. I'll never forget it. Tragically I have no pictures from the event.
Went with anni to this incredible music from this horror/hip-hop genreless band. Shoutouts to their guest singer Sharon Stone and also this girl who filmed with her 3DS.
Susi's sister! This is the second time seeing her and it was great.
My mate Rodrigo has a band and this was their first ever concert! It was sick. They play jazz fusion with wild time signatures. Tragically I did not take a picture.
Wow I didn't understand what a fun diva she is until this concert! One of the best ever. Went with Victor.

I love Spellling and seeing her live was great! I also got to meet her at the merch stand and she called me extra for being sassy about them not selling CDs. I went alone but bumped into my old friend Boris there.
Solo trip to see an old band I used to love 15 years ago. It was nice to hear them play all their old tracks and I got to meet the guy.
A concert-length dance routine from these two. A lot of fun. Only regret was that we queued in the freezing cold for the main Berghain before realising it was Berghain Kantine.
I was late to this because I'm an idiot and I'm still kicking myself about it. They played one of my favourite albums 'Imaginal disk' all the way through and it was amazing.
Great to see these guys live with Victor and Blanca. They played their album 'A la sala' as well as a bunch of classics.
Only have this image of the warmup band, but they were great. Unpolished rock music with a mosh pit. The electricity went out at some point.
Fuck this location, we weren't allowed to stand up?? Air played Moon Safari, a classic album, but literally just played the songs as is with no stage banter between.
A free concert from this very chill Brazilian artist that I've been following for a bit. Turned out to be a nice activity for a friend who was having a bad day.

Wow, one of the most sublime concerts ever. She gave an amazing political speech during it. The arrangements were stunning. But fuck this venue, we weren't allowed to go near the seats. I went on my own and met a really hot guy there.
Nerdy band from Scotland that I've been a fan of for a while. They played all their old songs, it was great! Bumped into my friend Uzay there.
The artist asked the audience not to take pictures and video but everyone did it anyway. Weird vibes during the concert! I got this snap at the start.
Maitén invited me to this and I loved it so much more than I thought I would!
Susi's sister! I didn't know her before this but was blown away she is so cool and the concert was great.
Bigger concert, don't love the location, but she was amazing. Went with Ort and new friends.
This was really nice as always, although nothing will live up to the previous concert he did which was perfect.
Best pop concert ever with Sam, Kitty and Ale. Queer crowd and I loved it when she sang my favourite song 'Billions'.
Beautiful, amazing, stunning, I love her. Went on my own and had a moment during 'God turn me into a flower'.
Bit of an awkward concert. She was visibly insecure and her bandmates weren't vibing with her. Venue isn't great.
Great music in a teeny-tiny venue where I couldn't see the band! I met them after though.
Loved this crowd consisting of middle aged Brazilian women and young queer white people. He was awesome. Went with new friend Mathis!
Went with Suzanne and Ort and Diego. They just played their songs normally without much stage banger. Diego got super high from my pipe and I still feel bad about it.
It was alright but they just played there songs one after the other, no surprises.
Went here with Sam and it was amazing! One of the best concerts! I'll never forget the song 'Photograph'
Wow! This turned me from a fan into a mega-fan. Cute, tiny concert for such a big star! This is also where I became friends with Ort.
Loved this concert! Jack and I went although it was way to loud volume-wise. I got to meet them after!
Mortified because I arrived late to this and it was a fancy sit-down venue. Also I ate an edible and got way too high during the concert.
Put on make-up with Sam to look extra non-binary for this concert! Highlights were warm up act Lil Mariko and being complimented on my kero kero bonito shirt.
One of my all-time favourite concerts. I'm a mega fan and he played all my favourite songs. Afterwards I got to hang out with him and share a drink!
Incredible concert! I went alone but it turns out loads of my friends were there that day. I loved the reveal of her outfit.
I remember looking at the crowd and thinking this is soul music for white people.
Dance music from this French duo I like. Went for a controversial top floor at Metropol and it wasn't too bad.
Release party for this local band, loved it! They played 'Verdächtig' twice.
These days I struggle with this band but they did play 'Whitecap' which is my fave. I respect that they have a different set every show.
She was honestly great and I'm a mega fan. We got on our knees and she briefly sang Violet Stars.
A legend! Loved this concert even though there was a special cordoned off bit at the front of the crowd for expensive tickets, kinda lame.
Awesome concert with awesome songs. I should go listen to them right now.
Went to see her right as she started complaining about white audiences! Am I the problem? (It was an amazing concert)
Felt a bit out of place at a hip-hop concert but I went with Marco and it was a great experience.
An all-time favourite concert. It was WILD! There was a moshpit and I saw people doing coke on the dancefloor (which for me at the time was an eye-opener).
I realised that maybe they're not as good as I thought they were. They made you hug a neighbour in their song 'Woman' but when I did it, it was weird and I felt awkward for going there alone.
Went with Lucas, it was alright! I wasn't a huge fan but it was a nice concert.
Amazing concert not least because the warm up act was Sampa the Great!
Big budget show with lots of lights and sounds! I didn't love love love this concert.
Loved this concert! I went with Mariana and we both had a huge edible before it. Very fond memories.
I remember feeling weird about going here alone and I realised it's totally cool.
Really enjoyed this one, although I don't love this band so much these days. It was nice to travel to Karlsruhe with friends.
She was touring her album 'Short Movie' which isn't my favourite. I remember she wore a beautiful flower dress.
Went on my own to this and felt really bad and awkward about it.
One of my all-time faves coming to the tiny town in Switzerland where I was living? Hell yeah.
Awesome that they came to Fribourg! I remember that the venue wasn't very full at all.
Don't remember too much about it apart from loving it.
I dragged my friend all the way to London to watch my favourite band at the time perform with a full orchestra! It was amazing!
Formative concert with best friend Oscar from childhood! It's a core memory, the heat, the giant dangerous bouncy ball, the drive home.
Loved loved loved hearing this rendition of 'Where do my bluebird fly?'. A lovely trip to London with Oscar.
